intro: Pimpinella saxifraga var. ovata, commonly known as the ovate cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are pinnately divided with a distinctive ovate shape, and it produces small white or greenish flowers. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
